text:
we are running tomcat on a middle loaded website.
after some time (about 6 days) it is dying and the tomcat process is no
longer present in process-list (ps -ef).
tomcat must be restarted to start serving again.

i made the experience, that tomcat produces more and more processes
(just now i counted 77!!) in ps -ef list.

what's the problem? can i configure tomcat to close no longer
used processes/threads? does it help to upgrade to a newer tomcat release?
creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Tomcat dying is usually a JVM problem ( a java program is not able to 
get outside the box - i.e. netscape shouldn't be crashing the way it does :-).
A workaround is to do a script that restarts it, but it's better to 
find out what happened. 

Regardign the number shown in "ps -ax", tomcat creates only one process, but 
multiple threads ( linux reports threads as processes ). The number is 
slightly bigger than the maximum number of concurent connections you 
get, most of the threads are sleeping most of the time. 

Let me know if changing the VM helps, I am very interested in this kind 
of informations. Could you try running TC3.3 ?
